title: Why OpenAI Co-Founder Believes AGI Won’t Arrive in the Next Decade
description: Even as OpenAI invests billions in compute to accelerate the path to AGI, former co-founder Andrej Karpathy believes true AGI remains a decade away. In a recent podcast with Dwarkesh Patel, he opined that while AI agents like Claude and Codex are impressive, achieving artificial general intelligence (AGI) still feels distant.
content:
Is Agentic Coding Just a Smart Intern Pretending to Know More?
Developers point out that guiding an AI agent to perform technical tasks correctly demands significant human effort and time.

title: Can you spot the real Big Ben? Four out of five Brits now use AI
description: Four out of five Brits are now using artificial intelligence in their everyday lives but 27 admit they know very little about it, according to new…
content:
Despite the technology becoming part of daily routines - from online shopping to making appointments - the findings reveal a gap between use and understanding.

title: How AI apps are reshaping retail ahead of holiday shopping season
description: Increasingly, when consumers ask ChatGPT, Claude, and other artificial intelligence apps for advice on gift ideas, the responses come back with “buy” buttons.
content: Last month, OpenAI introduced Instant Checkout, a technology that connects ChatGPT users to online stores and garnishes each recommendation with a “buy” button — enabling shoppers to complete a purchase without visiting a retail website. This technol... [4945 chars]

title: Apollo Says AI Energy Gap ‘Will Not Be Closed in Our Lifetime’
description: The amount of energy required to supply the data centers powering artificial intelligence is so vast that meeting that need may be more than a lifetime away, according to a senior executive at Apollo Global Management Inc.
content:

title: India proposes strict rules to label AI content citing growing risks
description: India's government on Wednesday proposed that artificial intelligence and social media firms should clearly label AI-generated content to tackle the spread of deepfake and misinformation, prompted by similar moves by the European Union and China.
